info.game_comments: Drawing for Season 3 & Season 4 players for the 10th Anniversary Tournament.

(1, 1).clue: It's the number of dancers you need to perform Vicente Nebrada's ballet "Gemini"

(2, 1).clue: This Redd Foxx series was based on a British sitcom called "Steptoe and Son"

(3, 1).clue: One of the strongest leathers is provided by this large marsupial

(4, 1).clue: In 1964 the Palestinian Arab guerrillas organized themselves as this group

(5, 1).clue: In blackjack, it's the point value held by the most cards

(6, 1).clue: One of the tallest ones ever built was about 400 feet high; it guided ships for 1500 years

(1, 2).clue: "Gartenfest" is danced to music written by this Austrian prodigy when he was only 13

(2, 2).clue: He's the "problem child" among the 3 Chipmunks

(3, 2).clue: Fleshed hides are treated with sodium sulfide in a lime & water solution to remove this

(4, 2).clue: When she was about 16 the "voices" told her to aid the Dauphin

(5, 2).clue: When wild cards are used in straight poker, this replaces the royal flush as the highest type of hand

(6, 2).clue: We don't know who this revolving food tray was named for, but she must have been quite "indolent"

(1, 3).clue: Jerome Robbins became associate artistic director of this Manhattan ballet company in 1949

(2, 3).clue: G. Burghoff, the only "M*A*S*H" regular to portray the same character in the film, played this role

(3, 3).clue: This soft leather got its name because the gloves made from it originally came from Sweden

(4, 3).clue: In 615 the Persian Chosroes II sacked this city, taking away the True Cross

(5, 3).clue: In 2-player War each person begins with this many cards

(6, 3).clue: It can be a meeting hall for the Moose, a place where skiers stay or a wigwam

(1, 4).clue: Jacques D' Amboise's ballet "Saltarelli" was inspired by the saltarello, a court dance from this country

(2, 4).clue: "The Flying Nun" was set at the Convent San Tanco on this island

(3, 4).clue: Although named for an antelope-like animal, this polishing cloth now comes mostly from sheepskin

(4, 4).clue: In 1816 he took control of the Zulu nation

(5, 4).clue: In contract bridge, bidding & making one of these can get you 1500 points

(6, 4).clue: Some of these primates are ruffed & some of them are ring-tailed

(2, 5).clue: It's the name of the vampire played 20 years apart by Jonathan Frid & Ben Cross

(3, 5).clue: This highly polished leather was once produced by applying several coats of varnish

(4, 5).clue: Called reckless & extravagant, she abdicated at age 27 & left Sweden disguised as a man in 1654

(6, 5).clue: This adjective that means extremely dismal comes from the Latin for "to mourn", lugere

(1, 1).clue: This country's 21 provinces include Honan, Hunan & Yunnan

(2, 1).clue: Texas wasn't the lone state admitted in 1845; it was this "Sunshine State"

(3, 1).clue: Antoine Lavoisier proved that burning & rusting are caused by a union of this element with other chemicals

(4, 1).clue: This aromatic herb, Origanum vulgare, is also known as wild marjoram

(5, 1).clue: They're the 2 cities in Dickens' "A Tale of Two Cities"

(6, 1).clue: In the Edda, the Norse equivalents of this biblical couple are Askr & Embla

(1, 2).clue: This country that stretches from Peru to South America's so. tip has an average width of about 110 miles

(2, 2).clue: The U.S. Naval Academy was founded in this city

(3, 2).clue: In ancient times, this yellow element was burned to fumigate homes

(4, 2).clue: A sharper Hungarian variety of this spice is made by grinding the plant's seeds with the pods

(5, 2).clue: She forced Tom Sawyer to whitewash a fence

(6, 2).clue: After Balder was killed, he was placed on a funeral pyre on one of these & burned at sea

(1, 3).clue: This country's 2 highest mountain peaks are named for James Cook & Abel Tasman

(3, 3).clue: Marguerite Perey named this radioactive element, symbol Fr, after her country

(4, 3).clue: An oil distilled from this herb is a source of menthol

(5, 3).clue: Kurt Vonnegut novel in which Billy Pilgrim "time-trips" between Earth & the planet Tralfamadore

(6, 3).clue: This thunder god's stepson Ullr is a superb skier

(1, 4).clue: Tutuila, on which Pago Pago is located, is the largest island of this territory

(3, 4).clue: The lightest of the halogens, its name is from the Latin for "to flow"

(4, 4).clue: Mace comes from the scarlet membrane that covers this other spice

(5, 4).clue: In "The Scarlet Letter", he's the father of Hester Prynne's daughter Pearl

(6, 4).clue: Andhrimnir is the cook who prepares the bounteous banquets at this hall of the slain

(1, 5).clue: The highest mountains in Europe are in this range between the Black & Caspian Seas

(2, 5).clue: John Couch Adams predicted the existence of this outer planet in 1845; it was found in 1846

(3, 5).clue: The Germans call this element Wasserstoff

(4, 5).clue: This licorice-flavored herb, Foeniculum vulgare, was used by the Romans to promote health

(5, 5).clue: In "For Whom the Bell Tolls", Pablo leads a guerrilla band with this woman, his wife

(6, 5).clue: This mischief-maker has several evil offspring, including Jormungandr, a giant serpent

(0, 0).clue: Since 1952 he's hosted a weekday talk & interview show on Chicago's fine arts radio station WFMT
